virtual ~TriangleMeshImplicit ()
 Standard destructor.
std::vector< Point3D > * getVertices ()
 Get the pointer to the vertices To get access to the vertices of the mesh, prefer getTriangleVertex(), as that function is more generic and complies to the ITriangleMesh interface.
void setVertices (std::vector< Point3D > *vertices)
 Set the pointer to the vertices.
std::vector< int > * getIndices ()
 Get the pointer to the vertex indices To get access to the vertices of the mesh, prefer getTriangleVertex(), as that function is more generic and complies to the ITriangleMesh interface.
void setIndices (std::vector< int > *indices)
 Set the pointer to the indices.
int getSize ()
 Get the number of triangles in the mesh.
int getNumberOfVertices ()
 Get the number of vertices in the mesh.
Point3D * getTriangleVertex (int triangleIndex, int vertexIndex)
 Get a vertex that belongs to a triangle.
int addTriangle (Point3D vertex1, Point3D vertex2, Point3D vertex3)
 Add a new triangle to the mesh.
void removeTriangle (int triangleIndex)
 Remove a triangle from the mesh NOTE: depending on the implementation of the triangle mesh, this might be a costly operation, as indices list might have to be updated.
void homogeneousTransformation (IHomogeneousMatrix44 *transformation)
 Applies a homogeneous transformation to the mesh.

int brics_3d::TriangleMeshImplicit::addTriangle ( Point3D  vertex1,
Point3D  vertex2,
Point3D  vertex3 
) [virtual]

Add a new triangle to the mesh.

NOTE: The semantics on how a triangle is inserted depends on the actual implementation of this interface.

Parameters:
vertex1First vertex that represents the triangle
vertex2Second vertex that represents the triangle
vertex3Third vertex that represents the triangle
Returns:
Returns the triangle index where it is stored

Point3D * brics_3d::TriangleMeshImplicit::getTriangleVertex ( int  triangleIndex,
int  vertexIndex 
) [virtual]

Get a vertex that belongs to a triangle.

Parameters:
triangleIndexThe index of a triangle. The fist triangle has index 0, the second has 1 and so on... The valid range is [0, getSize()]
vertexIndexThe index of a vertex the belongs to the triangle, specified by the triangleIndex. The valid range is [0, 2]
Returns:
Returns a pointer to the vertex

Implements brics_3d::ITriangleMesh.

void brics_3d::TriangleMeshImplicit::read ( std::istream &  inStream) [private, virtual]

Helper function for streaming input.

This function enforces that streaming functionality is implemented in derived classes. This is necessaray as the operator>> cannot be inherited (as it is already a friend)

Parameters:
[in,out]inStreamThe input stream
Returns:
Input stream

Implements brics_3d::ITriangleMesh.

void brics_3d::TriangleMeshImplicit::removeTriangle ( int  triangleIndex) [virtual]

Remove a triangle from the mesh NOTE: depending on the implementation of the triangle mesh, this might be a costly operation, as indices list might have to be updated.

Parameters:
triangleIndexThe index of a triangle. The fist triangle has index 0, the second has 1 and so on... The valid range is [0, getSize()]

void brics_3d::TriangleMeshImplicit::write ( std::ostream &  outStream) [private, virtual]

Helper function for streaming output.

This function enforces that streaming functionality is implemented in derived classes. This is necessary as the operator<< cannot be inherited (as it is already a friend)
